title: Projects
brief: These are some of the projects I've worked on recently. Some of it did earn me some money, some of it didn't. But all of them taught me something.

contents.title: Project Introduction
contents.content: An AI-powered chatbot solution designed to streamline specific business processes.

contents.title: Things I did
bulletPoints: As a Frontend Lead of the AI Team, I am responsible for the backend and chat interface development. Initially assisted in project understanding while the interface was outsourced due to political factors. Provided examples and stacks for the chat interface, but the delivered code, particularly for the backend, was nearly unusable. To address this, I proposed and led a complete rewrite alongside the UX/UI designer within one month, resolving package EOL issues and ensuring successful deployment.
Help and support another frontend engineer with its chatbot developing.

contents.title: Project Introduction
contents.content: Vendor Support Chatbot for Usage Problem Resolution

contents.title: Things I did
bulletPoints: Develop its backend socket server with Node.js
Developed the frontend with a seamless chatbot interface

contents.title: Project Introduction
contents.content: GUM is a project which is an outsource project from a company. The project is to build an official website and a dashboard for the company in the middle of the development. The official website provides the introduction of the courses and the registration function. The dashboard provides the management of the courses and the query of the registration data.

contents.title: Things I did
bulletPoints: Construct product pages with RWD design.
Construct common pages such as about us, contact us, and so on.
Construct partial functions of the dashboard.

details.title: Portfolio Website for a UI/UX Designer V2

contents.title: Project Introduction
contents.content: This portfolio website is build for my wife to enforce her UI/UX ability.

contents.title: Things I did
bulletPoints: Follow the figma design from the designer.

contents.title: Project Introduction
contents.content: Create a desktop app to manage Windows windows status and crawl data.

contents.title: Things I did
bulletPoints: Making sure that the specific window opens on Windows is always on top and make sure some of window should not be show up.
Line Notify API to send the message to the user when window is changed.
Crawl the data from the website and save it to specific excel file.
